category.title: Report Summary

result.title: Policy Recommendations on fairer Industrial Relations practices and regulations in Platform Economy
result.description: Brief policy paper to favour fairer industrial relations in the platform economy, so as to support a more inclusive corporate growth

result.title: Post-Privatisation and Corporate Political Responsibility: Negotiation of Rights and Duties in the Platform Economy.
National Reports on the state of art of Industrial Relations in Platform Economy
result.description: The research will focus on infrastructural platforms as GAFAM, their penetration in local and regional labor markets, their employment practices, the labor conflicts in which they are directly or indirectly involved, as well the specificities of the regulatory contexts in which they move within the different national industrial relations systems. All the info collected will be summed up in 4 national reports.

result.title: Outlook report on scenarios and regulatory options to tackle platforms' infrastructural character
result.description: D2.3 will discuss whether platforms will become utilities or whether their dominance as private sector actors will be maintained throughout the 21st century. Basis will be a comparison between the evolution of EU competition law versus US antitrust law from the 2000s onwards.

result.title: The Birth of a Power: Amazon between Infrastructurisation, Data Control and Resistence

details.authors: Maurilio Pirone, Mattia Frapporti, Niccolò Cuppini

result.title: Infrastrutture e piattaforme. Mutazioni politiche emergenti

result.title: A typology of platform power and its regulation

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
